page.title: 04Education in Saline Fife
page.content: Saline Primary School was built in 1875 with an extension being built in 1909. A second building was erected in 1928 and the two buildings served as a Primary and Secondary School for the village and surrounding area until 1955. Mrs Margaret Proudfoot is the present Headteacher of Saline Primary School, having a teaching staff of nine, a nursery nurse and a teaching auxilliary. The 206 pupils are taught a wide variety of subjects in keeping with the high standard of education available in Fife Region. The school children who stay at school for lunch have witnessed a pleasant alteration to the school building this year when a classroom was converted into a kitchen. This eliminated the transport of meals from a central kitchen 16 miles away. The school motto is Finis Coronat Opus
